result.execSummary:
The defendant Naeem Robert Bradley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DNA sample if not already done, pay surcharge.
Pay all Court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA.  Out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC.  Balance paid during Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with 14CF2607.  *March 28, 2017-Credit of 143 days.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 12 months Initial Confinement.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant.
Letter from defendant regarding DOC deductions.

Signed, Filed, and Distributed; Decision and order partially granting request for sentence credit. It is ordered that the defendant is granted a total of 129 days of sentence credit on counts one and three in 14CF2607. It is further ordered that the defendant is granted a total of 143 days of sentence credit on count one in 15CF2168.
Certification of SENTENCING transcript commencing 01-30-2017 received and filed. (29 Pages.) CH
Due date based on this case and 14CF2607.

Defendant Naeem Robert Bradley in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Naeem Robert Bradley in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 5 years, concurrent to 14CF2607, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 years, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 years. 

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 12 months initial confinement.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- DNA sample if not already done, pay surcharge.
- Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA,  out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
received from defendant.

Defendant Naeem Robert Bradley in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Naeem Robert Bradley in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements by: Lakedia M.  

States motion for a No Contact Order argued and granted by  the  Court.  Defendant to have no contact with Lakedia M.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 18.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 30, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Naeem Robert Bradley in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Naeem Robert Bradley in custody.  Irene Parthum for William Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Case adjourned to Branch 18.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Bench warrant served; copy in file.  Case set for return on warrant on 12-16-2016 at 8:30 a.m.  PD's office and ADA Berens notified via e-mail.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Naeem Robert Bradley not in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.  The Court ordered that the signature bond on deposit is forfeited.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report Discharge Summary received and filed.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report (missed telephone contact), received and filed.

Defendant Naeem Robert Bradley in court with Attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a review hearing.  The Defendant advised the Court that he is currently making an effort on finding a job and provided paperwork stating same.  The matter is set for a sentencing hearing on October 22, 2015 at 1:30pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Naeem Robert Bradley in court IN CUSTODY with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Naeem Robert Bradley in custody.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to "NO CONTEST". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Court addressed bail:  Defense motion to modify bail argued and DENIED.  

ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.
Case adjourned to 08-20-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Naeem Robert Bradley not in court, in custody.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 07-21-2015 at 3:00 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea Hearing.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Order; signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to Justice Point for processing.
Court MODIFIED bail to $500.00 cash with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision.  Standard rules of supervision.

**NOTE:  Court record event is incorrect.  Should be Bail/Bond Hearing.  Clerk and supervisor are unable to change.

Atty. Danielle Shelton appeared in court with defendant, Naeem Robert Bradley.  Defendant, Naeem Robert Bradley IN CUSTODY.  Maureen Atwell appeared on behalf of the State.

Court addressed bail:  Arguments heard.  Court MODIFIED bail to $500.00 cash with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision.  Standard rules of supervision.

Case adjourned to 06-24-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Scheduling Conference.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 06-10-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Naeem Robert Bradley in court with Attorney Edgar Lin, appearing for Attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Naeem Robert Bradley in custody.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has a lower number case pending in Branch 02.  

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is re-assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02, due to lower case pending.

Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.
Defense counsel informs he has not received discovery and requests case be adjourned for bail hearing.
Court orders case adjourned for bail hearing and scheduling conference in Branch 2.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Naeem Robert Bradley in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Naeem Robert Bradley in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
